entry.title: MB5L

entry.title: Best practice on Performance Forms for employees who switch to another job role/function
entry.content:
Hi SAP, 

Do you know what's the best practice if an employee switches to another job role/function regarding to his already launched performance form and goals created for old job role/function? 

Concrete scenario: 

  • Performance Form is launched for a particular year (e.g., 2026)
  • Goals are created for 2026 accordingly to an employees' job role/function
  • Employee switches to another job role/function during 2026. His/her goals need to be updated accordingly to new role. 
  • New Performance Form for the employee in his/her new job role/function will be launched
  • Problem: old goals are populated on this new performance form and are present in the goal plan (because same performance form for 2026 will be launched with same goal plan attached). 

Is there a known best practice for this?

  • Does the manager just simply deletes the old goals? But then the actions remain in Continuous Performance Management without being linked to the old goals? 
  • Or is it recommended to add an additional status for goals - annulated because old job function or something like that? But it will get really messy in the goal plan & on the performance form... 
  • Other ideas? 

Thanks a lot! 

Kind regards, 

Ellen

entry.title: Intermittent DBSQL_SQL_INTERNAL_DB_ERROR When Calling Trial Balance CDS View C_TRIALBALANCE_CDS
entry.content:
When calling the standard C_TRIALBALANCE_CDS OData service with a valid date range and filters, the request intermittently fails with DBSQL_SQL_INTERNAL_DB_ERROR. The issue appears more often when the $select clause includes many dimensions, even though the same request sometimes works. Looking for guidance on why this CDS view can return this error under higher-volume or more detailed selections.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Intermittent DBSQL_SQL_INTERNAL_DB_ERROR When Calling...
entry.content:
This error is not caused by the URL syntax, it happens when the C_TRIALBALANCE_CDS view tries to process too much data at once. The service has internal volume limits, and when they’re exceeded, HANA returns DBSQL_SQL_INTERNAL_DB_ERROR. To avoid it:

Reduce the number of dimensions in $select
Only request the fields you actually need. A wide $select (many splitting dimensions) creates a very large result set.

Limit the date range
Call the API by fiscal period or by smaller intervals instead of requesting long multi-period ranges.

Avoid full extraction patterns
The API is designed for analytical drill-down, not bulk historical extraction. If large-volume data is needed, retrieve it in multiple smaller calls.

These restrictions align with the service documentation and typically eliminate the intermittent DBSQL errors.

entry.title: SAP Continuous Influence in Finance and Risk - Q4/2025 Results
entry.content:
Dear Customers and Partners in the Finance Community,

Earlier this year I shared with you an overview of the various sessions available for Finance on SAP Continuous Influence. The CIP requests that you submit to these sessions are reviewed by our Product Management teams on a quarterly basis. The results are summarized for you on Customer Influence as a Blog.

Here you can find the results for the Q4/2025 Review Round in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Finance session, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Private Edition, Group Reporting session, and the new SAP Risk and Assurance Management session.

In each of these Blog posts you can not only read about the Customer Influence requests and their status but also learn about all the different innovations that have been delivered in our 2508 Release. Here you can find links to all 2508 related material, including the What’s New Viewer, Presentations, videos and links to the Finance Product Expert Trainings.

We are about to launch a new session for SAP Advanced Financial Closing. Stayed tuned!

Thank you for your continuous engagement and support throughout 2025! 

I look forward to providing you with an update and outlook on 2026 innovations very soon!

Best regards,

Helen

entry.title: Re: Cancel Billing Document Of Last Month
entry.content:
Dear @Lily16,

I'm sorry for answering today, but I didn't see the notification earlier. Below I paste the Badi code that I checked in my environment for the invoice billing date 14/07, after canceling it, the system entered today's date in the Billed On field, for example below:

 

IMPORTANT. First, verify it in your test environment before uploading it to the production environment

Custom Logic: SD_BIL_FLEX_CANCELLATION

cancellation_bil_doc_res = cancellation_bil_doc.

DATA lv_today              TYPE d.

DATA lv_first_day_curr_mon TYPE d.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <fs_cancel_billdate> TYPE any.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <fs_dev_postdate>    TYPE any.

lv_today = cl_abap_context_info=>get_system_date( ).

lv_first_day_curr_mon = lv_today.

lv_first_day_curr_mon+6(2) = '01'.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'BILLINGDOCUMENTDATE'

  OF STRUCTURE cancellation_bil_doc

  TO <fs_cancel_billdate>.

IF <fs_cancel_billdate> IS ASSIGNED.

IF <fs_cancel_billdate> < lv_first_day_curr_mon.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'BILLINGDOCUMENTDATE'

      OF STRUCTURE cancellation_bil_doc_res

      TO <fs_cancel_billdate>.

    IF <fs_cancel_billdate> IS ASSIGNED.

      <fs_cancel_billdate> = lv_today.

    ENDIF.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'DEVIATINGPOSTINGDATE'

      OF STRUCTURE cancellation_bil_doc_res

      TO <fs_dev_postdate>.

    IF <fs_dev_postdate> IS ASSIGNED.

      <fs_dev_postdate> = lv_today.

    ENDIF.

  ENDIF.

ENDIF.

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Manage group to team assignments for SAC within Identity Provisioning
entry.content:
Hi experts,

For our BTP landscape and SAP Cloud we have set up a central Cloud Identity Service (CIS) tenant to centralize the user management.

Now, for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) we have configured our central CIS tenant as bundled Cloud Identity Service tenant based on SAP help link:
Authentication Options | SAP Help Portal. 

Following this procedure a source and target system in the Identity Provisioning are automatically created. We just adapted the properties of the source system to include "idds.group.filter" and "idds.user.filter". On the target system we set the user and password according to the OAuth client created in SAC and added properties "ips.delete.threshold.groups" and "ips.delete.threshold.users".

Within the CIS we have following groups maintained for SAC:

CIS GroupSAC team

Technical name:
sac_dev_admin

Display name:
SAC Administrators (on Dev)

sac_admin

Technical name:
sac_dev_planning_user

Display name:
SAC Planning User (on Dev)

sac_planning_user

Technical name:
sac_dev_reporting_user

Display name:
SAC Reporting User (on Dev)

sac_reporting_user

Now, we want to adapt the transformation within the target system for SAC to ensure that all users assigned to the CIS groups will be assigned to the according SAC teams (example: users in group "sac_dev_reporting_user" should be assigned to the "sac_reporting_user" team in SAC)

We tried following:

{
	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%sac.group.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%sac.group.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",
		"mappings": [
			...,
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.groups[*].value",
				"preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
				"optional": true,
				"targetPath": "$.groups[?(@.value)]",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_admin",
						"replacement": "sac_admin"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_planning_user",
						"replacement": "sac_planning_user"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_reporting_user",
						"replacement": "sac_reporting_user"
					}
				]
			},
			...
		]
	},
	"group": {
		...
	}
}

Unfortunately, this was not working. Instead all team and role assignments were removed from all users.

How can we handle CIS group to SAC team assignments within the Identity Provisioning when group and team name differ?

It must be ensured that not only the initial assignment can be handled via Identity Provisioning but updates as well (such as changes in the CIS group assignments as well as removal from CIS groups).

 

regards

René

entry.title: Re: Copy Text from Sevrice Order to Billing Document
entry.content:
Hi Julius,

I have sent you a message.
Here are the steps:

  1. Create Service Order (App F3571A)
  2. Release Service Order
  3. Create 1st confirmation --> maintain text
  4. Create 2nd confirmation --> maintain text
  5. Edit Service order and maintain item texts and header texts
  6. Set item to "Completed"
  7. Release for billing
  8. App "Create Billing Documents" (F0798) --> no texts are available

entry.title: How to prevent the automatic creation of delivery and invoice of customer returns
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

After creating a returns order (CBAR), either through app or API, the system automatically executes two processes:

  • Automatic creation of delivery document;
  • Automatic creation of invoice.

Is it possible to prevent those automatic creations or delay it in any way?

Thank you.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent the automatic creation of delivery and...
entry.content:
Hello,

To prevent the automatic creation of subsequent documents, it depends on what channel is being used to create the returns order:

  • Via app Create Sales Orders (VA01):
    Set the the approval to 'Item to be revised'. The approval field is located in the 'Returns' tab of the Order.

  • Via app 'Manage Customer Returns - Version 2' > create:
    After fulfilling the order, click on the button 'Save' instead of 'Save and Release'. This will automatically set the approval field to 'Item to be revised'.

  • Via API:
    Set item level field 'RetsMgmtProcessingBlock' to 'R'.

You can also refer to the KBA 3491839 - Delivery Block set for document type CBAR not working.

Thank you. Have a great day!

entry.title: Re: How to activate the Object Store in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
Hi @aalbis,

Datasphere's Objest Store = using HANA Data Lake Files (HDLF) as storage/persistency. 
HANA Data Lake Relational Engine (a.k.a.  IQ engine) is different from HDLF.
Check out the terminology in detail: https://help.sap.com/docs/hana-cloud-data-lake/welcome-guide/sap-hana-cloud-data-lake-terminology

BR.

entry.title: Re: Does the CL_BCS_MAIL_MESSAGE API (e-mail via RAP) all...
entry.content: Is there any update on the on-premise situation? The current email-validation logic only works for different domains. It does not help when we want to avoid sending hundreds of emails to people from the same company with the same domain during testing or intake processes in development systems. We do not understand why SAP did not implement a simple whitelist or checklist mechanism similar to what is available in SCOT. We want to innovate and build most of our new applications using the RAP framework. However, the old mail APIs rely on COMMIT WORK, which is not supported in RAP applications. Because of this, SAP recommends using the new API class. The problem is that the new API always sends the emails immediately—even when running tests from development, intake, or quality systems. After weeks of discussions with SAP Support on our open case, the only answer we received is that their development team “does not see the need for whitelisting individual email addresses.” Are there really no other customers or companies facing the same issue?

entry.title: Re: Building a RAP Application: From Custom Actions to Sending Emails – A Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
The information to check the send email is incorrect. The emails are not displayed in transaction SOST when using CL_BCS_MAIL_MESSAGE. 

SAP  uses its own Fiori app “Monitor Email Transmissions” and the new transaction SBCS_MAIL_OUT to check the status

As a result, you can no longer use the SCOT whitelist to control or restrict outgoing emails—for example, when testing in intake or quality systems. If your company uses a single domain, it is impossible to whitelist specific recipients to ensure that only certain people receive test emails. For example running a test on quality systems,  results in emails that are always sent out immediately.

Does anyone know a workaround or fix for this?
The blog post mentioned above provides misleading information, because you no longer have control over outgoing emails through SOST.

entry.title: How to Post Components Linked to a Subproduct in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
We have a Bill of Materials (BOM) for our finished product AAAA (material names used here are only examples). The product goes through three resources.

  • In Resource 1, we post the consumption of raw material MP01.

  • In Resource 2, we post the packaging materials EM01, EM02, and EM03, and these quantities are correctly adjusted based on the good quantity of product AAAA reported at that operation, since they belong to the main BOM.

The issue appears in Resource 3.
Our finished product AAAA also has a by-product SU01 in its BOM for traceability purposes. However, in this resource, we not only post the by-product SU01 (movement type 531), but we also need to consume additional packaging materials SM01 and SM02 (also example materials).

The problem is that the system adjusts the quantities of SM01 and SM02 based on the produced quantity of the main product AAAA, instead of adjusting them based on the actual quantity of the by-product SU01.

In practice, we need something like a sub-BOM linked to the by-product and to Resource 3, so that the consumption of SM01 and SM02 is proportional to the quantity of SU01—not AAAA.

Is this possible in SAP S/4HANA? If not, what do companies typically do when they need to manage additional components tied specifically to a by-product?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Manufacturing  SAP Manufacturing Execution

entry.title: Re: Copy Text from Sevrice Order to Billing Document
entry.content:
Hello Simon,

thanks for sharing your steps. I check further details of the system configuration and I can confirm that your scenario is not supported. The reason is that only Service Confirmation data is transferred to Billing. But the text is entered in the Service Order and is not updated to existing Service Confirmations. Means, the text is not available in the Service Confirmation when you release it for Billing.

Best regards,
Julius

entry.title: Re: Copy Text from Sevrice Order to Billing Document
entry.content:
I recommend you to raise your requirement to enable the "Notes" tab in Service Confirmations by using the know channels such as WCR form or Customer Influence Portal (Campaign: Service).

In case the Service Confirmations are created via API, you can utilize the Text of Service Confirmation.

entry.title: How to integrate external sales forecasts into SAP ERP Cloud and consume them dynamically with SO ?
entry.content:
Context
A customer needs to:

  • Integrate sales forecasts from an external tool (PLM) into SAP S/4HANA Cloud.
  • Use these forecasts for production planning.
  • Automatically consume forecasts when firm Sales Orders are created.

Standard options analyzed and limitations:

  • Scope Item 3NR – Sales Scheduling Agreements
    ➡ Designed for EDI flows (DELFOR/JIT), generating deliveries directly from forecasts without Sales Orders.
    ❌ Does not meet the requirement: the customer wants firm orders based on forecasts, not automatic deliveries.

  • PIR – Planned Independent Requirements
    ✅ Allows forecast integration and consumption via Sales Orders (strategy 40).
    ❌ Limitation: aggregated by material only, losing customer-level granularity (Anaplan sends customer-specific data).

  • Scope Item 1O0 – Planning Apps for Sales
    ✅ Provides Fiori apps for analyzing historical sales and simulating internal forecasts.
    ❌ No integration of external forecasts, no automatic consumption by Sales Orders.

Question to the community
➡ Is there a standard solution or recommended approach in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to:

  • Integrate external, customer-specific forecasts?
  • Dynamically consume them when Sales Orders are created?

Any experience, best practices, or ideas (e.g., APIs, BTP extensions) would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Datasphere: Issues creating data federation connection between datasphere and S/4hana on-prem
entry.content:
Hi guys,

we´re currently in the process of connecting our datasphere to S/4HANA on-Prem using ABAP SQL services for data federation. We´re struggling to establish the connection with S/4HANA

During setup we followed the official documentation:

  • Cloud Connector: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/f289920243a34127b0c8b13012a1a4b5.html?locale=en-US
  • ABAP SQL Services: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/4d7474595a5b41bb986616262ff44a3a.html?locale=en-US

 

We get the following error message when trying to import remote tables in datasphere.

 

According to SAP Note 3076454 we have to install the ODBC driver on S4. However S4 team informed us no ODBC is required on S4 side but the pre-installed in datasphere is sufficient. Hence I´m a bit confused whether ODBC is needed on S4 for our scenario, any thoughts from your side?

In addition we have already checked Note 3586001 (https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3586001), but haven´t been able to resolve this matter.

 

We´ve already double checked:

  • Cloud connector settings
  • Firewall (hanacloud.ondemand.com / k8s-hana.ondemand.com) and whitelisting all necessary IPs

Everything seems fine.

 

The S4 connection is validated reachable in cloud connector.

 

We looked into the cloud connector logs and see a failing handshake request and terminated connection due to SSL/TLS communication. Any advice how to approach this matter further? Looks to me we might have some certificate issues between cloud connector – BTP – Datapshere - S4, but that´s not really my area of expertise.

 

Any help appreciated!

entry.title: Packaging Instruction Determination Not Triggering Dialog in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m having trouble with the packaging instruction determination in Public Cloud for Warehouse Management.

In configuration, under
Logistics, Transportation, and Warehousing / Tracking, Tracing, and Identification / Packing / Maintain Packing Transaction Profile,
for transaction profiles 0001 and 0025, I assigned the Determination Procedure for Packaging Instructions “000013” and enabled both “Packing Instruction Selection Dialog” and “Respect Alternative Packing Instruction.”

However, when I press the Packing button in the inbound delivery (VL31N) or when using the Change Inbound Deliveries app, no selection dialog appears, even though multiple alternative packaging instructions exist.

Is there something I’m missing? Is an additional step required to make the dialog appear?

Thanks in advance for any insights

entry.title: SAP B1 v10 SP2511 Installation Error on B1ServerToolsAuthentication
entry.content:
I got a new machine and was installing SAP B1 v10 SP1125 for a standalone instance.  I got through the new computer permissions errors quickly and got stuck on a failure of the server tools.   Specifically Authentication service (B1ServerToolsAuthentication): FAIL.  This was after creating my own certificate using openSSL, since the install was failing trying to create the installer created self signed certificate.  From the log I was able to find 

 Action result: FAIL (ScriptAction<\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1><post-install>)

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.InstallerThread.setRollbackPurpose]

[17:47:29][ INFO] Setting rollback purpose for B1ServerToolsAuthentication

[17:47:29][ INFO] Rollback system feature:

[17:47:29][ INFO] 1) B1ServerTools-Service-LicenseServer

This occurred after Tomcate Configuration Update:

[17:42:00][ INFO] ScriptAction<\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1><post-install>

[17:42:00][ FINE] Feature [B1ServerToolsAuthentication] status={SUCCESS}

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.actions.ScriptAction.onExecute]

[17:42:00][ INFO] Script action [\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1] started

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.machine.access.shell]

[17:42:00][ FINEST] Running command [Windows Script [\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1]]

[17:42:00][ FINEST] Updating enviroment variables:

It appears to be something to do with the configuration of the certificate and security when working with the certificate.   Any ideas would be appreciated.

entry.title: Performance - Link two forms directly
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Is there a way to link two forms directly? This follows the logic that there is a parent form from which the other form could be launched (so called "parent-child-relationship" between the two forms). In the best case scenario, you could then jump back and forth between the two forms and end up with shared documentation.

So, I would refer to a conditional launch, but tied to the user taking an action in the form. E.g. the user opens the form and works on it. In a section there is a button and with this button the user could launch another form to work on certain details and progress another route map etc. So the launch would be dependent on the click on this button by the user on the "parent form" and opening the "child form", not a job information or other master data change.

Is anyone familiar with this linking option, and can it perhaps be implemented with the new business rules and custom fields?

Thank you in advance and have a nice week!

Uli

entry.title: PO output via NACE to supplier’s contact person (AP role)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I want to send Purchase Order output via NACE not to the supplier (LF) but to a contact person of the supplier (Partner Role AP). The supplier has multiple contact persons with different e‑mail addresses, depending on the purchasing group.

I have maintained the contacts in BP with valid e‑mails and added AP in the partner determination schema. In NACE I set AP as partner role with medium = E‑mail and created condition records. Still I get errors like VN006 – Partner role AP not allowed for this document or “No or invalid e‑mail”.

How can I make sure that the supplier’s contact person (AP) is recognized in the PO and their e‑mail is used for output via NACE?

entry.title: SAP Learning Insights Intern View – Navigating Early Careers at SAP - with Domenic Glass
entry.content:
Dear Learners,

I am glad to inform you that we have recently been published on SAP Podcasts  

SAP Learning Insights Intern View – Navigating Early Careers at SAP - with Domenic Glass

In this episode of our Intern View mini-series, host Eden met with Dominic Glass, HR Senior Recruitment Consultant at SAP, to explore the world of recruiting for early talents. Dominic shares his journey from sociology studies to becoming a recruitment expert, offering invaluable insights into what makes SAP unique for early-career professionals. He emphasizes SAP's collaborative ethos "We rise by lifting others" and provides actionable tips for students looking to move into the tech industry. Whether you're preparing for your first interview or exploring career opportunities, this episode offers insider perspectives on what recruiters really look for in early talent candidates. It’s perfect for students, recent graduates, and anyone interested in understanding the modern recruitment landscape at one of the world's leading technology companies.

Related resources

    • Learn more about the SAP Internship Experience Program (iXp)
    • Explore the various student opportunities at SAP
    • Learn how students can certify in SAP for free with SAP Learning Hub, student edition. 

  • How to get started SAP Learning here are some resources:

    • Visit SAP Learning
    • Join our SAP Learning group

Enjoy listening to this new podcast! 

Subscribe to via
Spotify   Apple Podcast    TuneIn

entry.title: Harmonizing UI5 URLs: Convenient URLs for SAPUI5/OpenUI5 CDN
entry.content:
What Do We Do?

To further enhance consistency and ease of access, we are now making the convenient URLs the new default for all Demo Kit  resources. The following table shows the previous URLs and their short an convenient URLs:

Previous URLs

Short and Convenient URLs

openui5nightly.hana.ondemand.com

sdk.openui5.org/nightly

openui5.hana.ondemand.com

sdk.openui5.org

sapui5.hana.ondemand.com

ui5.sap.com

This follows our initial announcement “Short and Powerful: Convenient URLs for SAPUI5/OpenUI5 CDN”.

Why We’re Doing This

One URL for OpenUI5 and one for SAPUI5 improves search engine indexing and discoverability which will lead to better search results. It will simplify the access to our documentation and tools for developers and establishes consistent and future-proof domains which are independent from the platform they are served from.

What Will Happen?

To make the transition as easy as possible, we will gradually redirect users to the new URLs. Here’s what you can expect:

  • Demo Kit Resources (HTML pages) will be automatically redirected to the new URLs starting on:
    • OpenUI5: December 8th
    • SAPUI5: January 7th
  • Runtime Resources (everything else) will be redirected to the new URLs starting on:
    • OpenUI5: January 7th
    • SAPUI5: ~UI5con Germany 2026

These steps are designed to give everyone plenty of time to adjust to the new URLs and ensure a seamless experience.

What You Should Do Now

Make use of the short and convenient URLs now by...

  • ...updating your bookmarks to the Demo Kit to use the new domains
  • ...adopting your applications to bootstrap OpenUI5 or SAPUI5 from the new domains
  • ...sharing this update with your teams and communities to help us spreading this information (Hint: still the old netweaver.ondemand.com URLs are in use!!)

Although we redirect the existing URLs they are going to continue to work. Once the old URLs will be sunset, we’ll inform you early enough upfront.

Note: To bootstrap SAPUI5 in non-cloud scenarios please use the Standard Variant for Bootstrapping. See details on the difference in Docu: Bootstrapping from Content Delivery Network and in note 2943781.

Another note on Tracking Prevention when using these URLs: Please mind the respective information in "Browser and Platform Support" for SAPUI5 / OpenUI5 and note 3216225 on how to handle it.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - Using Variables and Functions in Rules for Automatic Postings
entry.content:
Introduction

Automating postings in SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting reduce manual effort and ensure accuracy in financial consolidation. With release 2508.2, you can now enhance your rules using variables, functions, and comparison operators. These features bring flexibility and precision to complex consolidation scenarios, making it easier to reflect real business conditions in your reporting.

 

What You Can Use in Value Calculation Formulas

Rules for automatic postings (you can find more details in this introduction blog) can include the following components in the value calculation formulas: 

  • Variables: Read amounts from data different from the source, such as margin rate from the partner unit or number of issued shares
  • Functions:  Evaluate and calculate values, such as Minimum, Average, or Balance
  • Comparison Operators: <, >, =<, =>, =

Scenarios

Here are some examples of how variables, functions, and comparison operators can automate postings:

  • Earnings per share: SOURCE (net income) / VARIABLE (number of issued shares) 
  • Percentage of direct ownership in the partner unit: 100 * SOURCE_QTY (number of owned shares) / VARIABLE (number of shares issued by the partner unit)
  • Inventory profit elimination using the margin rate, from the partner unit, for this material: SOURCE_GC (inventory) *  - 0.01 * VARIABLE (margin rate by material from the partner unit)
  • Non-controlling interest calculation for the net income: SOURCE_GC (net income) * (1 - (VARIABLE (group share %)))

 

Defining Variables

In the Manage Rules for Automatic Postings app, you define variables in the new Variables tab.

Each variable includes:

  • Selection: Defined in the Define Selections app
  • Measure: Local currency, transaction currency, group currency, or quantity
  • Period interval: periodic, year to date, etc.
    Here, you find the same options as for the source data definition in the posting rules.
  • Matching fields: Up to 5 fields used to search the variable data by matching their value with the source data. 

In the above example, the matching fields are defined to search the margin rate reported by the selling unit and by material that matches the source data (e.g. the inventory values reported by the buying unit, broken down by partner unit, and material).

 

Value Calculation Formula

When defining value calculation formulas, you can combine operators, variables, and functions.

 

Variables

  • Predefined variables:
    • SOURCE: all source measures (transaction currency, local currency, group currency, and quantity)
    • SOURCE_TC, SOURCE_LC, SOURCE_GC, SOURCE_QTY: specific measures
  • Custom variables: Defined in the Variables tab (active only)
  • Up to 6 variables can be used in one rule.

Functions

You can use the following functions:

  • Balance: Used when the value calculation defined for the posting lines use percentages.
    In this case it might be that the resulting posting is not balanced because of rounding differences. You can use the Balance function in one additional posting line to balance the posting. The parameter of this function is the maximum amount that the posting line can post.
  • First Not Null: Used to eliminate the inventory profit using the most precise margin rate.
    For example, you can define two variables (Margin rate by material number, Margin rate without material number) and define in the value calculation that the system must use the first variable that is not null using the     FIRSTNOTNULL function.
  • Multiple functions can be included or nested in the value calculation formula of posting lines.

Operators

You can use the comparison operators with the IF function to evaluate values, for example: IF (SOURCE > 0, VARIABLE1, SOURCE).

Examples of Functions and Variables in Value Calculations

Variables in the Log

When rules include variables in the value calculation formula, their values and names appear in additional columns, such as Variable 1, Variable 2.

In the example below, the rules calculates the direct ownership %. The number of owned shares (from the investor) is displayed in the Source Quantity column, and the number of issued shares (from the investee) is displayed in the Variable 1 column. The calculated direct ownership % is displayed in the Posted Quantity column.

More Information

  • Rules for Automatic Postings
  • How to Define Variables
  • Blog Introducing New Rules for Automatic Postings 

________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Special thanks to MareikeBaudewig for reviewing this blog!

entry.title: Re: PO output via NACE to supplier’s contact person (AP role)
entry.content: You will have to maintain partner function as CP for contact person and your NACE output with CP. I am assuming that you have maintained the CP with department as AP. If this needs to be picked up then you will have to give a custom code to pick thisare mentioning that an email should be going to a contact person at the vendor location . If just to the invoicing party that you want to send the output then maintain the output in NACE with PI as partner function and that should take care of it

entry.title: Re: Update Supplier's bank account number (S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
Hello Christine,

to update Business Partners you should use the "Manage Mass Maintenance - Business Partners" app  SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library. 

The migration object only supports the "Create" function of the API and not the "Update" function of the API.

Detailed description on how to use it can be found on the SAP Help Portal documentation: Manage Mass Maintenance - Business Partners | SAP Help Portal

BR

Frank

entry.title: msg group Accelerates Innovation with SAP Joule for Developers
entry.content:
Introduction 

Artificial intelligence is reshaping enterprise development, and SAP Joule for Developers in ABAP is at the center of this transformation. msg group, a leading re-insurance and transformation provider, is harnessing ABAP AI capabilities to modernize development, improve efficiency, and deliver more value to customers. 

 

About msg group 

With 25 years of experience in SAP products as well as custom development, msg group specializes in delivering innovative SAP solutions that help businesses run better. As a trusted SAP gold partner, they focus on state-of-the-art solution development leveraging modern ABAP Cloud techniques. 

 

The Challenge 

msg group faced a familiar challenge: 

  • Maintaining and modernizing large, complex ABAP codebases. 
  • Reducing the time developers spend on repetitive coding tasks. 
  • Meeting project demands for faster innovation without sacrificing quality. 

Traditional approaches often required significant manual effort, slowing down project timelines and increasing costs. 

 

The Solution: Leveraging SAP Joule for Developers in ABAP capabilities 

To overcome these challenges, msg group integrated ABAP AI capabilities into their development workflows. With features such as: 

  • AI-assisted code explanation to accelerate analysis of legacy ABAP coding. 
  • Joule Chat capability to support classic ABAP developers on their journey towards modern ABAP Cloud development. 
  • Automated unit testing generation to enhance reliability and reduce errors. 

ABAP AI enabled their developers to work smarter, not harder, freeing up time to focus on delivering business-critical innovations. 

 

The Results 

By adopting ABAP AI, msg group achieved measurable improvements: 

  • 20% increase in speed during the analysis of legacy ABAP code. 
  • Significant time savings for the initial generation of unit tests for ABAP classes and core data services. 
  • Increased developer productivity, allowing teams to focus on critical tasks and support other projects. 

Overall, this meant faster delivery of solutions, reduced costs, and higher satisfaction among all stakeholders. 

Learn more about msg’s use case here. 

 

Partner Perspective 

“SAP Joule for Developers is an essential part of the modern ABAP Cloud developer’s toolbox. It accelerates development with practical, high-impact use cases while empowering developers to decide how and where to apply it. This approach enables us to deliver innovation faster than ever — without compromising the quality our customers trust.” 
— Sebastian Freilinger-Huber, Principal IT Consultant, msg group 

 

Looking Ahead 

Building on these early successes, msg group plans to expand ABAP AI adoption across all business areas and projects developed on SAP BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud (Public and Private Edition). With SAP’s continued investment in AI, msg group is well-positioned to drive ongoing innovation and customer value. 

SAP Joule for Developers now unlocks even more potential with the new Custom Code Migration capabilities. These features streamline the transformation of classic ABAP code for SAP S/4HANA, making it easier to analyze, adapt, and modernize custom code with built-in explanations and guidance. For partners like msg group, it significantly reduces the effort required to transition customers to S/4HANA Cloud — while maintaining quality and accelerating time to value. 

 

Learn More 

Want to dive deeper into capabilities and use cases?  

Learn more about SAP BTP ABAP environment and  SAP Joule for Developers to explore how AI capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP Environment, can transform your development workflows.

entry.title: What is the best development pattern or architecture to follow in SAP CAP Node.js projects
entry.content:
I’m working on a growing SAP CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model) project using Node.js, and the team wants to adopt a consistent development pattern or architecture to keep the codebase clean, maintainable, and scalable.

I’m familiar with general backend principles like SOLID, but I’m not sure how well they apply in CAP, since a lot of the database interaction is handled through CDS services, entities, and the framework’s built-in handlers.

So my question is:

What is the recommended architectural pattern for CAP Node.js development?
Should we try to follow something like SOLID, or are there CAP-specific or Node-oriented patterns that work better?

I’d appreciate guidance or examples on patterns such as:

  • Service / Handler separation
  • Domain-Driven Design (DDD)
  • Clean Architecture
  • Repository or Data Mapper patterns (and whether they make sense in CAP, since CDS services already abstract the DB)
  • Modularization strategies for large CAP projects
  • Any best practices from real CAP projects in production

If you have suggestions, examples, or official recommendations from SAP, that would be extremely helpful.

entry.title: Enterprise Management bundle and scope countries deactivation
entry.content:
Hi,

We activated Baseline Accelerator and Enterprise Management Bundles for 21 countries by mistake. Post that, we have also completed 'Define Scope'. But after that, rest of the steps are still open. We are doing this in Customizing Tenant.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Enterprise Management bundle and scope countries deac...
entry.content:
Hi!

Once the Define Scope activity has been completed in the workspace, it is no longer possible to deselect the countries or bundles.

However, since the workspace has not been deployed yet, it is still possible to delete the workspace and restart the setup activities, this time excluding the unwanted bundle and countries.

Please refer to the following KBAs for further guidance:

  • 3381588 - How to delete the Workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration - SAP for Me
  • 3689937 - Not possible to delete Bundles in SAP Central Business Configuration - SAP for Me

Best Regards,

entry.content:
Hello,

WE HAVE COUNTRY OF RESIDENCE PICKLIST THAT HAS SAP STANDARD KOREA LABELS WITH COMMAS:

  1. Korea, Republic of
  2. Korea, Democratic People's Republic of

 

PROVISIONING ONBOARDING REPORT THAT FEEDS TO OUR SFTP THEN SAP ECC IS IMPACTING OUR INTERNAL JOBS IN SAP ECC BECAUSE THE COMMA IS COMING OVER FROM SUCCESSFACTORS LABEL.

CAN SAP STRIP THE COMMA IN BACK-END SO IT DOESNT IMPACT SAP ECC?                                                                                 

We already tried adding QUOTES " on the field that gets sent and it is supposed to tell the system to ignore the comma in the field and just look at everything in between the " " as the label but thats not working.

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Tax code via price determination cannot be determined...
entry.content:
Hello @Diego26 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/34cef32f5486451aa0fe114aa26ea817/145f4770a9c94575a1d2da8f99c51c3d.html?locale=en-US

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/the-difference-between-tax-categories-ttx1-and-mwst/qaq-p/14068947

To summarise, based on the scenario you described and the details I derived from your attached screenshots, it seems you only maintained TTX1 for the US but did not do same for DE. This might explain why the system cannot derive the tax code and generates the WS533 error.

Here is what I suggest:

Use the Set Tax Rates-Purchasing app to make the correction.

Set Tax Rates and create the necessary entries. Even if your transaction is IC inbound in DE, the RITT uses TTX1 and not MWST. Ensure your material tax classification supports this tax type.

Then you need to maintain material tax classification for DE using the Manage Product Master Data App.

Choose your material or product, go to Sales Tab, then Tax. Ensure you maintain DE --> TTX1, Tax Classification should be 1. If DE is missing, first extend the product to the DE sales org. (In you screenshots you only showed US classifications but no DE classification).

Your pricing procedure screenshots seem correct, so you do not need to carry out any modification there. The issue is rather tax rate availability in DE.

These steps should now allow your pricing to find TTX1 for DE, system will also determine the correct tax code and the document should save without the error.

You may also find this Blog interesting: SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Determine Tax Code in Purchase Documents using Condition Technique

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to convert Email in MBOX format safely?
entry.content: The safest way to convert MBOX emails is by using a dedicated tool like Stellar Converter for MBOX. It securely converts your MBOX files into PST or other readable formats without losing data, breaking folder structure, or corrupting attachments.

entry.title: Re: Why sapdevcenter doesn't work?
entry.content: To reset your SAP Universal ID password, visit the SAP Training Shop at learning.sap.com ,  click the profile icon, select 'Login', enter your S-user or P-user ID, and then choose 'Forgot password?' to follow the instructions.
